title: Woman, 37, is sentenced to 10 years for sex trafficking a 16-year-old girl
text:
A Wisconsin woman has been sentenced to 10 years for sex trafficking a 16-year-old girl in Iowa and Nebraska

Federal prosecutors say 37-year-old Brooklyn Pohl was handed her prison term on Friday. After serving her sentence, Pohl will be on supervised release for five years.

According to the prosecutors, officers made contact on November 22, 2016, with the underage victim at a truck stop in the Omaha suburb of Gretna.

Brooklyn Pohl, 37 (left and right), was sentenced to 10 years in federal prison, followed by five years of supervised release, on a sex trafficking charge

Investigators learned that Pohl and the girl had traveled from Illinois through Iowa into Nebraska between November 18-22.

They stayed at several motels along the way, with Pohl posting online ads featuring the teen's photo and offering the girl for sex acts.

Prosecutors say Pohl would help the girl negotiate prices with the customers.

According to officials, Pohl used some of the proceeds the teen earned through sex work to buy a car.

Federal prosecutors say Pohl took a 16-year-old across state lines for the purpose of pimping her out to clients for sex acts

Records indicate that Pohl has used various aliases and name spellings over the years, including Brooke, Brooklynn and Brooklynne.

She has a history of arrests in Wisconsin dating back to at least 2000.

A Facebook account associated with Pohl reveals that she has a seven-year-old daughter.
description: Federal prosecutors say Brooklyn Pohl took a 16-year-old girl across state lines for the purpose of sex trafficking and helped her negotiate prices with potential clients in November 2016.
